abstract.text: Returns a single-precision sparse matrix object that is stored in block-entry format with a variable block size.

Create a sparse matrix object that is stored in block-entry format and is ready to receive values from the various block insert routines. Blocks are are of variable dimension where the
’th block index has a dimension
. Block-entry format means blocks of dense regions will be stored at block indices
. For point wise format use non block version of create. See the various insert routines for details on inserting values into this matrix object.

Apple provides the BLAS and LAPACK libraries under the Accelerate framework to be in line with LAPACK 3.9.1. Starting with iOS 19, iPadOS 19, macOS 16, tvOS 19, watchOS 19, and visionOS 3, the libraries are in line with LAPACK 3.12.0. These new interfaces provide additional functionality, as well as a new ILP64 interface. To use the new interfaces, define
before including the Accelerate or vecLib headers. For ILP64 interfaces, also define
. For Swift projects, specify
and
as preprocessor macros in Xcode build settings.

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
Inserts a dense block of entries into a double-precision matrix.
Inserts a dense block of entries into a single-precision matrix.
Returns a double-precision sparse matrix object that is stored in block-entry format with a fixed block size.
Returns a single-precision sparse matrix object that is stored in block-entry format with a fixed block size.
Sparse matrix opaque type for float.
Returns a double-precision sparse matrix object that is stored in block-entry format with a variable block size.
Returns a single-precision sparse matrix object that is stored in block-entry format with a variable block size.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
